{"step_by_step_thinking": "The craniovertebral joint refers to the articulation between the skull (cranium) and the first two vertebrae of the spine (atlas and axis). The occipital condyle is part of the occipital bone in the skull and forms the articulation with the atlas. The atlas and axis are the first two cervical vertebrae and are involved in the craniovertebral joint. The wings of the sphenoid bone are located in the middle cranial fossa and are not directly involved in the craniovertebral joint. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Wings of sphenoid.", "answer_choice": "D"}
